abstract: Critics said a tide of lawsuits accusing banks of wrongfully breaking into homes reinforced their claim that the foreclosure process is fundamentally flawed.
snippet: Critics said a tide of lawsuits accusing banks of wrongfully breaking into homes reinforced their claim that the foreclosure process is fundamentally flawed.
lead_paragraph: TRUCKEE, Calif.  When Mimi Ash arrived at her mountain chalet here for a weekend ski trip, she discovered that someone had broken into the home and changed the locks.

headline.main: In a Sign of Foreclosure Flaws, Suits Claim Break-Ins by Banks
headline.print_headline: In a Sign of Foreclosure Flaws, Suits Claim Break-Ins by Banks
